unit_learning_outcomes.description: Program statistical analyses using the R programming language.
Generate data visualisations and publication-quality summary figures using the R programming language.
Design experiments and apply appropriate statistical methods to test hypotheses in the cognitive and brain sciences.
Interpret and critically evaluate the results of statistical analyses.

assessments.description: 10 short online multiple quizzes designed to provide routine assessment and feedback. Graded on credit/no-credit basis. The 2 lowest quizzes (missed or marked non-credit) may be dropped without penalty.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: COGS2020 - Experimental Design and Data Analysis for the Cognitive and Brain Sciences

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: In this unit, students will learn essential principles of experimental design and data analysis skills for research in the cognitive and brain sciences. Students will gain first-hand experience applying these skills by analysing real-life behavioural and neural data sets such as those from fMRI, MEG, and EEG. Students will learn the R programming language, which is widely used throughout the statistics and data science communities in academia and private industry. Topics covered include programming statistical analyses and visualising data in R, effective experimental design for hypothesis testing, and critically examining the results of statistical analyses in the cognitive and brain sciences.
data.search_title: COGS2020 - Experimental Design and Data Analysis for the Cognitive and Brain Sciences

description: In this unit, students will learn essential principles of experimental design and data analysis skills for research in the cognitive and brain sciences. Students will gain first-hand experience applying these skills by analysing real-life behavioural and neural data sets such as those from fMRI, MEG, and EEG. Students will learn the R programming language, which is widely used throughout the statistics and data science communities in academia and private industry. Topics covered include programming statistical analyses and visualising data in R, effective experimental design for hypothesis testing, and critically examining the results of statistical analyses in the cognitive and brain sciences.
title: Experimental Design and Data Analysis for the Cognitive and Brain Sciences
